greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of k-regular multigraphs on n labeled nodes, loops allowed, n >= 0, k >= 0.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..405 (diagonals 0..27)
maple: seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 23 2020
mathematica: b[l_, i_] := b[l, i] = Function[n, If[n == 0, 1, If[l[[n]] == 0, b[Sort[ ReplacePart[l, n -> Nothing]], n-1], If[i < 1, 0, b[l, i-1] + If[i == n, If[l[[n]] > 1, b[ReplacePart[l, n -> l[[n]]-2], i], 0], If[l[[i]] > 0, b[ReplacePart[l, {i -> l[[i]]-1, n -> l[[n]]-1}], i], 0]]]]]][Length[l]];
Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 12}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 07 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: my(acc(p, v)=my(z); mapput(M, p, if(mapisdefined(M, p, &z), z+v, v)));

my(recurse(r, h, p, q, v, e) = if(!p, if(ok(x^e+q, r), acc(x^e+q, v)), my(i=poldegree(p), t=pollead(p)); self()(r, limit, p-t*x^i, q+t*x^i, v, e); for(m=1, h-i, for(k=1, min(t, (limit-e)\m), self()(r, if(k==t, limit, i+m-1), p-k*x^i, q+k*x^(i+m), binomial(t, k)*v, e+k*m)))));
for(r=1, n, my(src=Mat(M)); M=Map(); for(i=1, matsize(src)[1], forstep(e=0, limit, 2, recurse(n-r, limit, src[i, 1], 0, src[i, 2], e)))); Mat(M);
T(n, k)={if(n%2&&k%2, 0, vecsum(MultigraphsWLByDegreeSeq(n, k, (p, r)->subst(deriv(p), x, 1)>=(n-2*r)*k)[, 2]))}
xref: Cf. A059441 (graphs), A167625 (unlabeled nodes), A333351 (without loops).
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 23 2020
